properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Flood Risk Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The evacuation order remains in effect for the people within the Hamlet of Fort Vermilion that live east of 50th street, north of the Golf Course, River Road, and Boreal Housing. Residents are permitted to conduct home inspections during specified hours in certain areas. ### Fort Vermilion residents entering the permitted areas must show their evacuee bracelets. More information is available from local radio or by going to the Mackenzie County Facebook page.
Expires: 2020-05-10T12:32:12-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Mackenzie County, 2020-05-03T12:30:33-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6384
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional rainfall: Trace to 2 mm. Locations: southern Avalon Peninsula. Timespan: ending after midnight. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-04T04:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-03T23:46:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2887053412.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From St. Jean Baptiste To St. Adolphe
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from St. Jean Baptiste to St. Adolphe due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca. Follow @MBGov and @MBGovRoads on Twitter or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-05-05T12:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-05-03T11:48:53-05:00, B19D2604-07D1-9F33-9BE4-F204F13F5815
Area: Red River from St. Jean Baptiste to St. Adolphe
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system over central Alberta is bringing a sharp change in the weather. Significant precipitation will impact parts of western and central Alberta tonight and through the day on Monday. Most of the precipitation will fall as rain, with general rainfall totals of 15 to 30 mm expected. In excess of 50 mm of rain is possible north of the Edmonton Metropolitan Region by the time the rain ends Monday evening. Thunderstorms have developed in a few regions and are expected to weaken this evening. Localized downpours are expected. To the west, the rain will change over to snow as temperatures cool tonight. This is particularly true for higher elevations, where 10 cm of snow is possible by mid Monday morning. In addition, winds with gusts up to 70 km/h will accompany this system. These winds will ease Monday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T17:37:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T01:38:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1635655428.2020

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Water Supply And Quality Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: A boil water advisory remains in effect for Fort Vermilion. The water may be unsafe to drink or use due to the Peace River Ice Jam flooding. The flooding has caused a disruption in water supply for the hamlet of Fort Vermilion. Both Fort Vermilion truck fill stations remain closed. The water supply for La Crete has been restored and the La Crete area truck fills are operational. ### All potable water truck fill stations in the Fort Vermilion area remain closed. Only use water for essential uses such as cooking and personal hygiene. Go to www.mackenziecounty.com/peace-river-ice-jam-flood-information for more information.
Expires: 2020-05-10T09:12:12-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Mackenzie County, 2020-05-03T09:11:32-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6383
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds briefly gusting near 100 km/h will occur late this evening. Winds are expected to diminish after midnight. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T09:01:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T04:08:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1419006383.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system developing in central Alberta is bringing a sharp change in the weather. Significant precipitation will impact parts of western and central Alberta tonight and through the day on Monday. Most of the precipitation will fall as rain, with general rainfall totals of 15 to 30 mm expected. In excess of 50 mm of rain is possible north of the Edmonton Metropolitan Region by the time the rain ends Monday evening. Thunderstorms have developed near Red Deer this afternoon and will continue into this evening. Localized downpours are expected. To the west, the rain will change over to snow as temperatures cool tonight. This is particularly true for higher elevations, especially the Swan Hills. 10 to 15 cm of snowfall accumulation is expected near the Swan Hills by Monday afternoon. In addition, winds with gusts up to 70 km/h will accompany this system. These winds will ease Monday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T14:12:46-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy wet snow expected on the Alaska highway Monday. A moist frontal system approaching from the south will move into the Fort Nelson region tonight and then stall over the area for Monday. Precipitation will begin as rain over all areas tonight and then switch to wet snow over higher terrain west and south of Fort Nelson by early Monday morning. Snowfall amounts may reach 10 cm Monday particularly near the Rocky Mountains. There is also a slight chance that the rain will switch to wet snow over higher elevations of Fort Nelson with little or no accumulations expected. The snow is forecast to ease or change to showers late Monday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T16:00:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T00:01:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3538426319.2020
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Heavy snow has developed in the Whitecourt region and is expected to continue through the overnight hours into Monday morning. Snowfall accumulations are expected to reach 10 to 15 cm by the time the snow tapers off, with the highest amounts expected to be near and over the Swan Hills ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T18:25:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T02:26:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3193926224.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A frontal system will move into northern BC tonight. Rain will begin this evening, but will change to snow at time heavy tonight and continue into Monday. Snow is expected to ease Monday afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-04T15:39:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-03T23:40:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0603906341.2020
Area: Muncho Lake Park - Stone Mountain Park
